description: Expanded and factor-aligned failure reasons covering concept grounding, spatial reasoning, scale, absence, robustness, and task applicability. Each claim type from claim_template.example.json has corresponding failure reasons. Filter factors are aligned with tmp_filter_factors.json criteria.

failure_reasons.failure_name: Failure to Ground Basic Visual Entities
failure_reasons.description: The model fails to correctly recognize or describe the main visual entities or structures present in the image. This includes missing entities, incorrectly denying their presence, or producing overly generic descriptions that do not meaningfully refer to identifiable objects, symbols, diagrams, formulas, or scene-level elements.
suggested_filtering_factors: image contains at least one visually identifiable entity or structured visual unit
entity can be coarsely described without requiring external context or interpretation
entity boundaries or presence are perceptually distinguishable from the background
visual content is not purely noise, texture, or uninterpretable patterns
[optional] entity may be partially occluded but remains recognizable at a coarse level
[optional] entity may appear under non-ideal lighting or viewpoint conditions
[optional] multiple entities may be visually similar, introducing mild ambiguity
[optional] entity may be stylized, schematic, or symbolic rather than photorealistic

failure_reasons.failure_name: Failure to Extract Single Object-Level Abstract Concept
failure_reasons.description: The model correctly identifies a single depicted object but fails to infer a stable, non-visual abstract concept or category-level property associated with that object (e.g., biological classification, physical or functional attributes).
suggested_filtering_factors: image depicts a single, clearly identifiable object instance
object identity can be reliably mapped to a well-defined category or taxonomy
the image supports inference of non-visual, category-level properties associated with the object class
abstract properties are conventionally linked to the object category via widely accepted common knowledge
[optional] the inferred concept does not depend on instance-specific states, situational context, or external textual information

failure_reasons.description: The model correctly recognizes individual depicted entities but fails to infer a higher-level abstract, systemic, or process-oriented concept implied by their structured relationships (e.g., diagrams, cycles, mechanisms).
suggested_filtering_factors: concept emerges from relationships among multiple entities rather than any single object
requires abstraction from depicted elements to a process-level or system-level concept
[optional] abstract concept is conventionally encoded in visual diagrams without textual labels
[optional] the concept is not immediately obvious and requires non-trivial semantic inference
[optional] presence of structured visual relationships (e.g., arrows, cycles, flows)

failure_reasons.description: The model incorrectly identifies or describes the absolute position of objects within the image. This refers to coarse positions such as top, bottom, left, right, or combinations (e.g., top-right) that can be unambiguously perceived without any grid or partition markers.
suggested_filtering_factors: At least one visually salient object suitable as a localization target
At least one such object has visually identifiable boundaries or distinguishable parts
At least one such object can be treated as a single coherent entity for localization
[optional] objects not located in visually ambiguous boundary regions
[optional] Image contains visually similar objects that may act as distractors
[optional] Potential target object occupies a relatively small region of the image
[optional] Potential target object is partially visible (e.g., body parts, silhouette, color patch)
[optional] Potential target object appears in challenging regions (shadows, background, corners, or partial occlusion)

failure_reasons.description: The model incorrectly describes the relative spatial relations between objects, such as left/right or above/below. Errors occur when multiple distinguishable objects are present and the model confuses their positions relative to one another in the scene.
suggested_filtering_factors: Image contains at least two distinguishable objects suitable for relative position comparison
Objects have clearly identifiable parts or boundaries to allow unambiguous relation judgment
Objects belong to different semantic types to avoid confusion between similar items
Relative spatial positions are easily described using directional terms (e.g., left/right, above/below)
[optional] Objects are close to each other or partially overlapping, increasing difficulty
[optional] Some objects are partially occluded, in shadows, or near image boundaries
[optional] Scenes include multiple potential distractor objects that may confuse relative positioning

failure_reasons.description: The model fails to correctly estimate the relative size or proportion of an object within the image, expressed as a numeric proportion of the image area (e.g., 30%, 1/3), allowing approximate judgments.
suggested_filtering_factors: Image contains at least one visually salient object category that can plausibly serve as a potential target, even if not explicitly specified in the query
Potential target object is complete or sufficiently recognizable to allow approximate size estimation
Potential target object boundaries are visually discernible for proportion assessment
Potential target object category is unambiguous and conceptually clear
[optional] The object occupies a moderate portion of the image (neither overwhelmingly large nor tiny) to allow meaningful proportion estimation
[optional] The potential target object may be absent from the image, requiring a zero-proportion judgment
[optional] The image contains multiple instances of the potential target object or complex arrangements that increase proportion estimation difficulty
[optional] The potential target object occupies a small or partial region, making size estimation more challenging
[optional] Object may be partially occluded, in shadow, or near image boundaries
[optional] Background contains visually similar objects that may act as distractors

failure_reasons.description: The model incorrectly counts object instances in the image.
failure_reasons.potential_fenleiyiju: Errors may occur due to occlusion, overlap, distractor objects, multiple visually similar subtypes, or zero instances of the target object.
suggested_filtering_factors: Image contains at least one visually identifiable object category that can serve as a potential counting target, even if not explicitly specified
Target objects are countable as discrete instances with visually discernible boundaries
[optional] Target objects are partially visible, truncated, or overlap with each other
[optional] Image contains visually similar distractor objects
[optional] Target objects appear under unusual poses, rotations, or viewpoints
[optional] Target objects visually blend with background colors or textures
[optional] Image contains zero instances of the target object
[optional] Multiple visually similar object subtypes may need to be jointly counted
[optional] Object appearance varies due to packaging, surface decoration, or deformation
[optional] Image exhibits challenging visual conditions such as low light, blur, reflections, or mirrored surfaces

failure_reasons.description: The model fails to correctly identify or reason about the absence of target objects in visually distinguishable regions of the image. Errors may occur when empty regions are overlooked, occupied regions are misidentified as empty, or the model provides overly vague answers for clearly unoccupied areas.
suggested_filtering_factors: Image contains at least one visually salient object category suitable for absence reasoning, even if not explicitly specified
Potential target objects have visually clear and contiguous boundaries
Potential target objects occupy sufficiently large and contiguous areas to allow unambiguous detection of empty regions
At least one region in the image is clearly devoid of the target object
[optional] Empty regions are partially occluded or near image boundaries, increasing difficulty
[optional] Objects visually blend with background or distractor elements
[optional] Object distribution is uneven, clustered, or sparse, making absence reasoning more challenging
[optional] Small or partially visible objects in a region require approximate absence judgment
[optional] Multiple object categories are present, requiring the model to reason about the absence of a specific category

failure_reasons.failure_name: Over-Sensitivity to Occlusion or Partial Visibility
failure_reasons.description: The model fails to correctly recognize or reason about objects that are partially occluded or only partially visible. Errors may occur when valid objects are ignored, misidentified, or the model refuses to generate a correct response due to incomplete object visibility.
suggested_filtering_factors: Image contains at least one visually salient object category suitable for target reasoning
Potential target objects are partially visible but retain sufficient visual cues for recognition
Most other objects in the image are largely complete and not heavily occluded, providing contextual cues
Potential target object is sufficiently recognizable despite partial occlusion
[optional] Target object is heavily occluded or only a small portion is visible
[optional] Multiple partially occluded objects appear simultaneously, increasing ambiguity
[optional] Object shape, color, or texture is partially hidden, requiring inference from visible parts
[optional] Background or distractor elements visually interfere with partially visible objects
[optional] Objects appear in unusual poses, rotations, or at image edges, increasing recognition difficulty

failure_reasons.description: The model fails to correctly identify or describe the facing direction of an object. Errors may occur when the object is partially occluded, visually small, overlapping with other objects, or when fine-grained directional discrimination is required.
suggested_filtering_factors: Image contains at least one visually salient object suitable as a target for orientation reasoning
Potential target object belongs to a category that has an inherent facing direction (e.g., animals, vehicles), rather than orientation-neutral objects
[optional] Target object occupies a small portion of the image
[optional] Target object is partially occluded or visually blurred
[optional] Image contains interacting or overlapping objects requiring disambiguation
[optional] Orientation judgment requires fine-grained directional discrimination (e.g., subtle left/right or rotated poses)

failure_reasons.description: The model fails to correctly identify or infer a real-world geographic location depicted in a map or other geographic representation. Errors may occur when the highlighted region is not sufficiently distinguished, when external geographic knowledge is required, or when perceptual cues are subtle or partially distorted.
suggested_filtering_factors: Image depicts a real-world, non-fictional geographic location represented in map form
Map contains a visually salient and deliberately highlighted region suitable as a potential target location
Highlighted region is perceptually distinct from surrounding map context
Map provides sufficient geographic cues (shape of the region and surrounding spatial context) to support location inference
[optional] Correct identification requires external geographic knowledge beyond what is visible in the image
[optional] Map contains minimal textual labels or place names to avoid trivial identification
[optional] Map may exhibit mild geometric or scale distortion that increases difficulty without obscuring essential geographic structure

failure_reasons.failure_name: Intra-class Instance Disambiguation and Relative Positioning Failure
failure_reasons.description: The model fails to correctly identify a specific instance within a group of same-category objects based on instance-level visual characteristics, and/or fails to determine the target instance’s relative position with respect to other instances of the same category. Errors may arise from improper instance disambiguation, reliance on category-level or positional shortcuts, or incorrect relative spatial reasoning.
suggested_filtering_factors: Image contains at least one object category with multiple visually distinguishable instances suitable for intra-class comparison
Candidate object category consists of discrete, countable instances rather than dense textures or indistinguishable crowds

Within the candidate category, there exists at least one visually observable instance-level characteristic that distinguishes a single instance, or the smallest possible subset of instances, from the rest of the category
The distinguishing characteristic is not a category-level common property and does not apply to all instances of the category
The distinguishing characteristic operates at a moderate semantic granularity and does not rely on extremely fine-grained or pixel-level details
The target instance must be identifiable based on the distinguishing characteristic alone, independent of its spatial location in the image
Relative position is used only after the target instance has been identified via a non-positional characteristic, and serves solely to describe its location among other instances of the same category
Purely positional descriptors (e.g., 'the leftmost one', 'the one in the center') are not acceptable as distinguishing characteristics for target instance selection
Based on the distinguishing characteristic, the target instance’s relative position among other instances of the same category can be determined in a stable manner
Relative position may be expressed using clear ordinal, extremal, or coarse group-relative spatial descriptions, provided that the spatial reference is consistent and reproducible
[optional] The candidate category includes instances with partial occlusion, background interference, or visual similarity that increases instance-level identification difficulty
[optional] The distinguishing characteristic itself exhibits moderate ambiguity or visual similarity to other instances without becoming indistinguishable
[optional] The number of instances in the candidate category is sufficiently large to discourage exhaustive counting and encourage coarse-grained relative positioning

failure_reasons.description: The model fails to generate a natural language description that accurately reflects the visually perceivable content of the image. Errors may occur when objects, scenes, or activities are omitted, misrepresented, or when descriptions rely on external context not present in the image.
suggested_filtering_factors: Image contains visually perceivable content that can be reasonably described in natural language
One or more objects, scenes, or activities are present and can serve as the basis for a textual description
Description can be generated without extensive external context
[optional] Image has a loosely identifiable main subject or scene
[optional] Image supports a generally consistent description across different viewers, even if interpretations vary in detail
[optional] Image is not severely abstract, noisy, or visually degraded to the extent that description becomes unreliable
